last_know_loc:
CrimeStoppers and the Honolulu Police Department is seeking the public’s assistance in locating witnesses regarding missing person, Milton Ishii.  Ishii who suffers from Dementia, was last seen leaving his Makakilo residence on Tuesday, November 26, 2019, at approximately 8:30 a.m.  Ishii is known to frequent the Kapolei and Waipahu areas.  His family and friends are concerned for his safety and well-being. 

Anyone who may have seen Ishii or may know his possible whereabouts is asked to contact police or CrimeStoppers. 

Missing:   Milton Ishii
Race:        Japanese
 Age:          76 years old
Height:      5’4”
Weight:     145 lbs.
Hair:          White
Eyes:         Brown

CrimeStoppers and the Honolulu Police Department is seeking the public’s assistance in locating Milton Ishii who suffers from Dementia.  Ishii was last seen leaving his Makakilo residence on Tuesday, November 26, 2019, at approximately 8:30 a.m.  Ishii is known to frequent the Kapolei and Waipahu areas.  His family and friends are concerned for his safety and well-being.

CrimeStoppers and the Honolulu Police Department are seeking the public’s assistance in locating Regan Thompson, who may be emotionally distraught. She was last seen by her family at her Kailua area home on Thursday, November 7, 2019, at approximately 11:30 a.m. She may be driving a red 2020 Kia four-door sedan bearing Hawaii license plates TTY 750. Her family and friends are very concerned for her safety and well-being.

CrimeStoppers and the Honolulu Police Department is seeking the public’s assistance in locating Antonina Kabanchenko, who suffers from a medical condition that requires daily medication. Antonina was last seen walking away from her residence on Kapiolani Boulevard on Sunday, September 29, 2019 at approximately 8:15 p.m. Her family and friends are concerned for her safety and well-being.

Missing: Antonina Kabanchenko
Race:      Ukranian
Age:       38 years old 
Height:   5’4”
Weight:   110 lbs.
Hair:       Dyed Red
Eyes:       Blue
Clothing: White collared shirt, blue shorts, black sneakers, black fanny pack around waist.

CrimeStoppers and the Honolulu Police Department is seeking the public’s assistance in locating Steven Meyers. Steven last spoke with his family on Saturday, September 7, 2019, at approximately 6:00 p.m. He was possibly driving his gold 1999 Nissan Altima four-door sedan bearing Hawaii license plates NCS 444. The vehicle has since been located and recovered. Steven works and frequents the Kapolei and Campbell Industrial areas. Family and friends are concerned for his safety and well-being.

Missing: Steven Meyers
Race:  Hawaiian
Age:  52 years old 
Height:  6’1”
Weight:  240 lbs.
Hair:  Black
Eyes:  Brown

CrimeStoppers and the Honolulu Police Department is seeking the public’s assistance in locating Carla Peterson, who may be emotionally distraught. She was last heard from on Saturday, September 21, 2019 at 8:00 a.m. Her family and friends are concerned for her safety and well-being.

CrimeStoppers and the Honolulu Police Department are seeking the public’s assistance in locating John Meeth. He was last seen at his Nuuanu area home on Wednesday, May 29, 2019. He is known to frequent the Waimanalo and Diamond Head areas.  His family and friends are concerned for his safety and well being.

CrimeStoppers and the Honolulu Police Department are seeking the public’s assistance in locating Manuel “Noli” Duran, who was last heard from on Friday, December 7, 2018, when he set sail in a kayak, bound for the Philippines.  Duran had apparently planned this trip in advance, purchased supplies in hopes to make it to the Philippines in 30 days to visit his girlfriend and daughter.  Duran’s vehicle, a 2005 gold Chevy Astrovan bearing Hawaii license plates RRY 208 is also missing.  His family and friends are very concerned for his safety and well-being.

CrimeStoppers and the Honolulu Police Department are seeking the public’s assistance in locating Thomas Borel, who may be emotionally distraught.  He was last seen leaving his Fort Shafter residence on Saturday, January 12, 2019, at approximately 9:00 a.m.  He may be possibly driving a 2013 white BMW bearing Hawaii license plates RZX-523.  His family and friends are very concerned for his safety and well-being. 

Missing:   	 Thomas Borel
Race:         Caucasian
 Age:           29 years old
Height:      6’1”
Weight:     200 lbs.
Hair:          Brown
Eyes:         Blue 
Vehicle:     2013 white colored BMW 2dsd bearing State of Hawaii license plates RZX523

CrimeStoppers and the Honolulu Police Department are seeking the public’s assistance in locating Kyle Wong.  He was last seen leaving his Kalihi residence on November 14, 2018, at approximately 1:00 p.m. Wong may be emotionally distraught and suffers from a medical condition that requires daily medication.  His family and friends are very concerned for his safety and well-being.

CrimeStoppers and the Honolulu Police Department are seeking the public’s assistance in locating Bernadette Rosa. She was last seen by a family friend on February 1, 2018, in the Waianae area. She has not been seen or heard from since. Rosa is known to frequent the Downtown Honolulu area. Family and friends are very concerned for her safety and well-being.

CrimeStoppers and the Honolulu Police Department are seeking the public’s assistance in locating Andrew Fine, who was last seen on March 18, 2016, at approximately 12:00 a.m.  He was seen leaving Lehoku Street area in Waianae in his blue four-door 2000 Dodge Stratus bearing Hawaii license plate NZA 916.  He is known to frequent the Waianae, Makaha, and Pearl City areas. 

Missing:        Andrew Fine
Race:             Caucasian
 Age:               48 years old
Height:           5’11”
Weight:          180 lbs.
Hair:               Black and Gray
Eyes:              Hazel
Complexion:  Tan

CrimeStoppers and the Honolulu Police Department are seeking the public’s assistance in locating Melissa Estoy. She was last seen leaving her Waianae home by a family member on Tuesday , January 16, 2018, at approximately 4:30 p.m.  Her vehicle was located at Zablan beach in Nanakuli on January 18, 2018, at approximately 2:30 p.m.  Her family and friends are very concerned for her safety and well-being.

CrimeStoppers and the Honolulu Police Department are seeking the public’s assistance in locating William Oliver.  He was last seen on Tuesday, 
November 1, 2016, in the Sand Island/Keehi Boat Harbor area.  He suffers from emotional distress and his friends and family are very concerned for his safety and well-being.

CrimeStoppers and the Honolulu Police Department are seeking the public’s assistance in locating Letitia Turner, who suffers from mild Dementia and uses a cane to walk. She was last seen at her Pearl City residence on Monday, September 19, 2016, at approximately 11:45 a.m. Family and friends are very concerned for her safety and well-being.

CrimeStoppers and the Honolulu Police Department are seeking the public’s assistance in locating Jonathan Fraser who was last seen on July 30, 2016, at approximately 9:30 a.m., in the Hawaii Kai area. He suffers from a medical condition that requires daily medication, and may be driving a 1994 black Honda Civic bearing Hawaii license number SXC-021. He is known to frequent the Kaneohe area.

CrimeStoppers and the Honolulu Police Department are seeking the public’s assistance in locating Andrew Fine, who was last seen on March 18, 2016.  He was seen leaving the Lehoku Street area in Waianae in his blue four-door 2000 Dodge Stratus bearing Hawaii license plate number NZA 916.  He suffers from a medical condition that requires daily medication and has not been seen or heard from since.  He is known to frequent the Waianae, Makaha, and Pearl City areas.

CrimeStoppers and the Honolulu Police Department are seeking the public’s assistance in locating John cousin who was last seen on April 16, 2016, at approximately 8:45 p.m., in the Hawaii Kai area.  He suffers from a medical condition that requires daily medication. He is known to frequent the Hawaii Kai and Kaimuki area.
